events.message: The applicant completed and submitted the personal loan application online, specifying the loan is intended to cover upcoming medical expenses.
The loan application was reviewed and categorised under personal loans, given the stated purpose related to medical bills.
Loan officer Sarah M. was assigned to manage the application and guide the applicant through the remaining steps.
The initial review covered the applicant’s financial background and existing debt obligations for a preliminary eligibility check.
Applicant was requested to submit proof of income, identification documents, and recent medical invoices to verify loan purpose.
All requested documents, including medical bills and income statements, were submitted promptly by the applicant for review.
Credit bureau results were received indicating a moderately good credit score with a history of timely payments.
Risk assessment evaluated the applicant’s creditworthiness and potential risk factors associated with the proposed loan.
A loan offer with interest rates and repayment terms was presented to the applicant for consideration and approval.
Applicant responded with acceptance of the loan terms and requested clarification on the first repayment date.
The application was escalated to the underwriting manager for final review due to the loan amount exceeding the officer’s limit.
Underwriting manager approved the loan application after confirming all documents and checks met internal policies.
The loan amount was transferred to the applicant’s bank account as per the agreed-upon loan terms.
Loan officer contacted the applicant to confirm receipt of funds and to provide assistance with repayment scheduling.
The loan application was officially closed after successful funding and completion of all initial post-approval procedures.
